config.slicePositionDescription: posterior(-) or anterior(+) distance to anterior commissure
aboutHtml: BigBrain is a high-resolution 3D digital atlas of the human brain, resulting from a joint effort of the Montreal Neurological Institute and the Forschungszentrum Jülich. It was released in June 2013 as part of the European Human Brain Project.

It consists of 7,404 coronal sections, each 20 µm thick, stained using the Nissl method that causes a dark stain in neuronal cell bodies. The slices have been digitized at 20 µm resolution and reconstructed back into a volume, thereby correcting for tears, shifts and deformations.
This Scalable Brain Atlas template shows a 400 µm downsampled version of the Bigbrain data. The full resolution atlas is available at bigbrain.loris.ca.

definingCitations.title: BigBrain: an ultrahigh-resolution 3D human brain model.
